P4's approach seems less distinctive and adaptable than P5's, and eliminating P4 preserves more strategic diversity in the game.

message:
# Final Statement to the Jury

Throughout this game, I've tried to be authentic, strategic, and fair. I've built genuine connections with many of you while making tough decisions based on gameplay rather than personal vendettas.

I believe I've demonstrated adaptability and resilience, surviving despite being targeted multiple times. My strategy evolved as the game progressed, balancing self-preservation with meaningful alliances.

P6 has played well too, but I hope you'll recognize my consistent approach and willingness to make difficult choices transparently. I'd be honored to have your vote as the winner of this elimination game.

# Final Statement to the Jury

Throughout this game, I've tried to be authentic, strategic, and respectful in my interactions with each of you. I've built genuine connections rather than just alliances of convenience, navigating this competition with integrity even when making difficult decisions.

If you've appreciated our conversations and felt I played honorably while still making strategic moves to reach this point, I'd be grateful for your support. 

The journey to this final two required adaptability and genuine relationship-building. I hope our interactions, whether brief or extended, demonstrated my commitment to playing a game that balanced strategy with sincerity.

Thank you for your consideration.
